notes.note:
Copy Link to Highlight allows users to [share arbitrary sections of page][1] with others by copying a link through the context menu with a given selection.


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/URI/Reference/Fragment/Text_fragments

This version introduces a new phase of privacy protections, building on our research on reducing browser fingerprinting. These new defenses cut the percentage of users seen as unique almost in half, ensuring a safer and more private browsing experience in Private Browsing or when using Enhanced Tracking Protection set to Strict.

Starting with Firefox 145, [32-bit Linux is no longer supported][1]. We encourage users to install a 64-bit version of Firefox.


  [1]: https://blog.mozilla.org/futurereleases/2025/09/05/firefox-32-bit-linux-support-to-end-in-2026/

Support has been added for the `Atomics.waitAsync` proposal, which is a non-blocking, asynchronous version of `Atomics.wait`. This allow synchronization of threads based upon the value in a shared memory location, for more details please consult our [MDN documentation][1].


  [1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Atomics/waitAsync
Added Matroska support for the most commonly used codecs: AVC, HEVC, VP8, VP9, AV1, AAC, Opus, and Vorbis.

The [text-autospace][1] property is now supported, allowing automatic spacing adjustments between characters from different scripts.


  [1]: https://drafts.csswg.org/css-text-4/#text-autospace-property

Microsoft UI Automation phased release rollout at 100%. Microsoft UI Automation is the new accessibility framework for Microsoft Windows. This will provide better assistive technology (AT) support and performance on Windows for current and future assistive technologies.

The WebGPU DOM API ([spec][1]; [MDN][2]) is now available on macOS 26 (Tahoe) on Apple Silicon. For details, see the [Mozilla Graphics Team Blog][3].


  [1]: https://www.w3.org/TR/webgpu/
  [2]: https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/WebGPU_API
  [3]: https://mozillagfx.wordpress.com/

system_requirements:
## Windows

### Operating Systems (32-bit and 64-bit)
 - Windows 10 or later

### Recommended Hardware
-  1 gigahertz (GHz) or faster compatible processor or System on a Chip (SoC)
-  1GB of RAM / 2GB of RAM for the 64-bit version
-  500MB of hard drive space

---

## Mac

### Operating Systems
- macOS 10.15 or later 

### Recommended Hardware
- Macintosh computer with an Intel x86 or Apple silicon processor
- 512 MB of RAM
- 200 MB hard drive space

---

## GNU/Linux

### Software Requirements

*Please note that GNU/Linux distributors may provide packages for your distribution which have different requirements.*

- Firefox will not run at all without the following libraries or packages:
    - glibc 2.17 or higher (glibc 2.28 or higher on arm64)
    - GTK+ 3.14 or higher
    - libglib 2.42 or higher
    - libstdc++ 4.8.1 or higher (libstdc++ 6.0 or higher on arm64)
    - X.Org 1.0 or higher (1.7 or higher is recommended)
- For optimal functionality, we recommend the following libraries or packages:
    - DBus 1.0 or higher
    - NetworkManager 0.7 or higher
    - PulseAudio
title: Firefox 145.0 Release
